alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 4:05PM EDT until July 05 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cumberland County in central North Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 405 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen near Bonnie Doone. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fayetteville, Fort Bragg, Pope AFB, and Bonnie Doone. This includes the following flood prone locations... Spruce St at Little Cross Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
